1148741113874625.title: Corporate Finance Manager
1148741113874625.location: Menlo Park, CA • New York, NY • Full Time
1148741113874625.responsibilities: Lead the structuring, negotiation, and execution of non-recourse financings for Meta’s data centers and other infrastructure projects Develop and maintain complex financial models to evaluate project economics, identify key risks and sensitivities, and support decision-making Drive financial due diligence efforts, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to facilitate robust risk assessment and mitigation Prepare and deliver presentations and communications to executives, credit rating agencies, and other key stakeholders Manage multiple concurrent projects, ensuring timely execution and alignment with Meta’s strategic priorities Stay current on market trends, financing structures, and regulatory developments relevant to infrastructure and project finance Support ad hoc strategic finance initiatives as needed
1148741113874625.minimum_qualifications: 10+ years of experience in finance, capital markets, or related functions Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or a technically related field Expertise in building and analyzing financial models for infrastructure projects, including risk identification and sensitivity analysis Hands-on analytical problem-solving skills with a track record of prioritizing among multiple deliverables Effective collaborator with proven experience communicating complex topics to a wide variety of stakeholders, including Meta leadership and credit rating agencies Experience managing multiple projects and collaborating across internal and external teams
1148741113874625.preferred_qualifications: MBA, JD, or other relevant advanced degree Experience in data center, infrastructure, or project finance at an investment bank or financial sponsor Demonstrated success in raising or investing capital for data centers, energy infrastructure, or similar large-scale projects

1474404313779164.location: Bellevue, WA • Menlo Park, CA • Seattle, WA • New York, NY • Full Time + 3 more • Full Time - Hide
1474404313779164.responsibilities: Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches. Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products that serve billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses. Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta

1589287305882721.title: OptoMechanical Design Engineer
1589287305882721.responsibilities: Design, develop, and optimize the Smartglasses or AR glasses eyepiece, including optical, mechanical, and electrical components Connect system PD and module designs with fit study and total stack tolerance analysis to ensure seamless system level integration and optimal performance Develop and maintain detailed design documentation, including 2D and 3D CAD models, drawings, and specifications Guide FEA team for mechanical simulation, structural risk assessment and design optimization of display system Collaborate with optical and thermal engineers for Structural Thermal Optical Performance multiphysics analysis of display system performance Conduct end-to-end design and DFM reviews, tolerance analysis, verification and validation to ensure design meets requirements and specifications from optical modules to system level Drive FMEA, failure analysis, tolerance analysis, gauge R&R, and the GD&T activities supporting product scalability in close collaboration with process, manufacturing and RELteams Apply engineering expertise in the areas of opto-mechanics, precision manufacturing, metrology, and tooling design to drive vendors, including CMs, external equipment manufacturers, part suppliers, and integrators for design improvement and technical problem solving
1589287305882721.minimum_qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Optical Engineering, or a related field 7+ years of experience in complex opto-mechanical system design and analysis, development, and optimization In-depth understanding of mechanical design as it relates to optical performance, precision engineering, and manufacturing process 5+ years of hands-on experiences with at least one of the CAD design tools, such as NX, SolidWorks, Creo, or similar Experienced in GD&T standards, dimensional metrology, statistics, Gauge R&R, and their application to process and design controls in high volume manufacturing Experienced with design for manufacturability and assembly, with a focus on cost-effective and efficient design solutions Demonstrate analytical and problem-solving skills to analyze complex systems and identify innovative solutions Working knowledge of optical principles, including geometric optics, wave optics, optical components, adhesives, etc Familiarity with industry-standard optical design and testing tools, such as Zemax, CodeV, FRED, or similar Demonstrated experience with communication and collaboration skills, and can work effectively with cross-functional teams
1589287305882721.preferred_qualifications: MS or PhD in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience Experience working on mechanical design and productization of augmented reality (AR) or virtual reality (VR) display systems Extensive hands-on experiences on NX is preferred Hands-on experience with mechanical simulation tools, such as ANSYS or Abaqus, with working knowledge of material behaviors including polymers, adhesives, and brittle materials Working knowledge of main optical components in one or more of the following areas: waveguide design and manufacturing, Lens design, active dimming, eyetracking Knowledge of image processing and optical-display metrics, such as MTF, contrast, luminance, uniformity etc Familiar with data processing and analysis tools like JMP, Tableau, Matlab, Python, R, etc Experience working with offshore Contract Manufacturers in delivering consumer electronics products in mass production
1589287305882721.compensation: $139,000/year to $200,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
